text: alright guys we are taking the peanuts cracking them open and getting the seeds ready we're gonna be planting some peanuts this year hi foresters this is where we're going to put the peanuts and I'm just I put some compost down a little bit more topsoil just trying to amend the soil a little bit it's some really good rich stuff anyways but so we're going to do is I'm just mixing it all in and loosening up the soil because peanuts need loose soil and we're going to plant these things about a foot and a half apart so I'm gonna go ahead and finish mixing this up and we'll get back to you with the planting - maybe the eggplant we had in there could be that big gigantic thing [Music] all right here's the nuts we had to take them out of the shell you just show them you got to use raw peanuts these are from Burpee so these are seed peanuts you can get just you can go out and buy the green peanuts but we're so we're going to plant these about a foot and a half apart 18 inches or 16 inches oh that would be 18 inches about 18 inches apart that but some of these might be a little close but they'll be all right and about a foot and about I'm gonna drop two in [Music] you [Music] we have leftovers we have to make us another little patch somewhere all right we can keep I can put them in a little ziplock bag all right all right now what do you do now we cover them up just loosely yeah you know what we can just keep a hold of these extras in case a squirrel sniff these out yeah because we got to worry about swirls or oil to be loose wherever I put my hands I need that yeah that's gonna be so cool if we can grow our own peanuts alright now we just got to clean up huh [Music]
